rules.ruleString: (Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {MID2004, MID2105} OR  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {MID2010})
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {MID2107, MID2108, MID2109}

description: The unit will prepare students with the theoretical knowledge and skills to assess, examine and initiate emergency management on the newborn infant. Anatomy and physiology relating to the newborn infant and human lactation will be explored. Students will develop an understanding of multidisciplinary care and collaborative practice in the management of sick newborn infants in a Level II Nursery. In addition, students will critically analyze all nutritional choices for well and sick babies and develop an understanding of the socio-cultural elements surrounding the care of newborn and their families.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
